1st Question :- HOW MANY AVATARS ARE THEIR OF MAA KALI ?

It is always said in Hindu Culture that all Goddess are one . but this is said because all the mother goddess are the avatar‚Äôs of the Maa Adi Shakti or Maa Adi Bhagwati or Maa MahaKali . but this doesn‚Äôt mean that all avatar‚Äôs have no difference in between them. Their are considerable differences in between all the mother goddesses .

To Note :- for example their are 64 goddesses , who are collectively called as ‚ÄúYogini Devi‚Äù. but each are different in every possible way ..

Similarly during navaratra we worship nine goddesses who are collectively called as ‚ÄúNava Durga Mata‚Äù . but each are greatly different from one another .

In The Same Context it is general thinking of people who know less or nothing about mother Kalika that their is only one form (or avatar) of her but in our study across various puranik literature and tantrik references we were able to find different ‚Äì different incarnation of goddess who is called by the same name ‚ÄúKali or Kalika‚Äù . And all these different forms or incarnation though have the same name but have a completely different iconography moreover the entire DIFFERENT mythological story is told in the reference of that particular avatar or incarnation .

In this section we will only try to understand about those different incarnation ,and yes when we are done with we may feel that all are about single mother goddess but we will also know that all the incidence of when Maa Kali Appeared or took an Avatar. How these forms are similar or what are the striking difference in between each of them ..

But Before going into details of What we have find out about different Incarnations who are called Maa Kali , First we will like to answer of How Many forms are their of Mahakali ?

:‚Äì> 1St Page Reference :- Now when we were researching about the Different Incarnations of Mother Kali we find out about various references but the first one which attracted our attention was was a statement from ‚ÄúForward‚Äù Section of The Reference Book we Have Used in our Stude about Maa Kali. The Name of The Reference in ‚ÄúMahaKala Samhita:- Kamakala Khand‚Äù which was written by Dr Kishor Nath Jha . In the Forward Section which was written by G.C.Tripathi who was the Principal of G.N.Jha K.S. Vidyapeeth, Allahabad Who wrote and we quote :-

‚ÄúGoddess Mahakali, according to this text, is the Chief Goddess of the whole Tantric System based on Vamacara Practices Who Manifests Herself in 51 (Fifty one) different female forms, Some Furious and other benign, in order to receive worship from her devotee according to their own concept of divinity and subjective preferences .‚Äù (Page snapshot attached below)

from these lines we were able to get some idea their may be 51 Different forms or incarnations or manifestations of Mother Mahakali. So we dived into the reference for further study .

1st Avatar.) MOTHER MAHAKALI (Or Just ‚ÄúKali Maa‚Äù):-

‚ÄúTHE CREATOR OF THE UNIVERSE & THE MOTHER OF ALL THREE GODS ‚Äì BRAHMA VISHNU & MAHESH (SHIVA)‚Äù

Mahakali is a eternal form who is commonly seen as the creator of universe. She is the supreme goddess of all creation and in various tantra shastra she is said to have 51 different manifestations by different scholars and tantriks, in which some appears to be furious and some appears to be benign. but all depends on the concept of divinity and based on subjective preference. this number has been in detailed explained in various pauranik and tantrik shastra.
